intro: Tripetaleia bracteata var. longiracemosa, commonly known as the long raceme tripetaleia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features elongated, branching inflorescences known as racemes, which are a defining botanical trait. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. The flowers are small and yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in botanical gardens.
